meanings.definition: To obstruct or hinder the progress of something.
meanings.sent1: The fallen tree was beclogging the path, making it hard to walk through.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam was beclogging the road, causing delays for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The beclogging pile of laundry in my room was so high, it almost reached the ceiling!
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure was beclogging her mind, preventing her from taking any risks.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog beclogging the city made it impossible to see more than a few feet ahead.

meanings.definition: To fill or block with an accumulation of something.
meanings.sent1: Leaves were beclogging the gutter, causing water to overflow during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The sink was beclogging with food scraps, making it difficult to drain the water.
meanings.sent3: The beclogging pile of toys in the playroom made it impossible to walk without stepping on something.
meanings.sent4: His mind was beclogging with worries, making it hard for him to focus on anything else.
meanings.sent5: The river was beclogging with debris after the heavy rain, creating a dam-like effect.
